snippet: The owner and trainer of Tonalist, the Belmont Stakes winner, understood why Steve Coburn, a co-owner of California Chrome, was upset, but the reality was that they put their horse first.
abstract: Joe Drape On Horse Racing column rejects proposal by California Chrome's co-owner Steve Coburn, pointed at Belmont Stakes winner Tonalist, that the Preakness and Belmont be open only to horses that run in the Kentucky Derby; says his proposal would tempt too many owners to push horses too hard too soon, as well as eliminate late-developing 3-year-olds; suggests Coburn respect the fact that Chrome gave it his all, and came up short.
lead_paragraph: The owner and trainer of Tonalist, the Belmont Stakes winner, understood why Steve Coburn, a co-owner of California Chrome, was upset, but the reality was that they put their horse first.

headline.main: A Triple Crown Tradition Prevails at Belmont Stakes Despite Sour Grapes
headline.print_headline: A Triple Crown Tradition Prevails Despite Sour Grapes
